headline: Avocado Smoothie
description: This avocado smoothie is rich and creamy thanks to a combination of vanilla yogurt, avocado, and honey. Perfect for a refreshing on-the-go breakfast.
name: Avocado Smoothie

recipeInstructions.text: Place milk, avocado, yogurt, and honey into a blender; add ice cubes and blend until smooth.

review.reviewBody: I made this recipe exactly as written and loved it. This smooth, creamy smoothie has a sweet taste despite the savory flavor of the avocado. One could easily mistake this smoothie for a dessert. If your kids like the individual ingredients and can get past the light green color, like my son did, they will enjoy this, too.
Delicious, creamy, and refreshing
I love this smoothie, I did add some lemon and lime juice and a little agava longside the honey.
Replaced honey a with a frozen banana for sweeting (like I saw in another recipe) and added some spinach to the mix. It was delicious. Everybody at home liked it. I wish I had done more.
Omgggg this was sooo good. I followed the recipe exactly and itâ€™s soooooo creamy. It took a short time to make and I def recommend it.
Instead of milk, I used coconut milk and half the amount of honey. Very yummy and now also vegan.
I thought it was good but I couldn't really taste the avacado. I would have liked to taste the avacado in it too
Waaay too much honey and not sure the vanilla yogurt helped. Didn't at all taste very much of avocado. Will not be making this one again.
Really delicious! Perfect amount of yogurt. Next time, I will probably only do 2 tbsp of honey (too sweet for me). I also added some quick oats to give it some texture.
it was very good but personally for my taste I would make it less sweeter i think the honey was a little too much
Was good
A little less honey and a little more milk is more to our liking but all and all it's awesome!
I used some dark honey that brought out the avocado test. So if you're trying to hide it, use the lighter honey

Didn't follow 100%, sorry we all have different tastes 
I just change the vanilla yogurt to Greek yogurt, + add vanilla essence, and only 1 teaspoon of honey. 
Perfect and sweet enough for me, no ice because its winter time at the moment. 
SoOoooo DelicioOooousssss
I substituted the yogurt with a banana and added a bit more ice. OMG...my husband and I love this smoothie!

Didn't add ice.
Used powdered sugar instead of honey.
Will try again. Definitely a tasty recipe.

This is a delicious and very refreshing smoothie. I have a dairy allergy so I used Almond Milk in place of the milk.
I will make this again.
Thank you for the recipe.
June 25/2019.
Was surprised at how good this was

Very good and refreshing! My avocado was on the way out, and I was able to salvage about 3/4 of it. I cut back a bit on the other ingredients and went very light with the honey (a tblsp?), and it was plenty sweet. I used Greek vanilla yogurt and added a scoop of vanilla protein powder. Nice change from the banana and other fruit-based smoothies!
Dee-licious! Made this after my wisdom teeth extraction and was the only thing I ate (besides ice cream). Smooth, creamy, dreamy!!

I changed plain vanilla yogurt to Chobani blueberry yogurt, and it was delicious. I always add a pinch of salt just for flavor, barely enough to taste. So smooth, creamy, and light! Will definitely make again.
I made it put extra honey in and did not like it but my 4 year old daughter loves it. I love avocados just not this way I guess.
I made this using oat milk, and it was really good.
Tastes great!
makesomething like better than Love yourself. It is important to stay positive because beauty comes from the inside out and it sucks
I added 1/2 tsp of cinnamon
I will make this and dairy free with rice milk! My Native American ancestry cannot handle this much dairy. I will also add wheatgrass powder!!!

So smooth and creamy! Love this! Even my husband thought it was fantastic despite being leery at first. Another time, I didn't have plain yogurt so substituted lemon yogurt and it was equally delicious.
Wowwwwww, I love it
I was really looking forward to this and at first, it tasted alright but then as I kept drinking it just tasted worse and worse and I got diarrhea from it at least 10 minutes later.
Made it exactly as it appeared, but did add one stalk of celery. It was amazing. Like healthy ice cream!
Delicious!
I loved it!!!! I added whey protein and 1/2 an avacado!!!!!!!!!!! YUMMY,
great brekfast
It is kind of bland flavor wise but it's still worth having the recipe to play with.
WAY too much honey. It was like I was drinking a honey smoothie. You could barely taste the avacado.
So creamy and yummy!
I used (2) avocados and (1) cup of yogurt...delicious!

I loved every bit of this smoothie. The texture was amazing. I used almond milk instead regular milk and plain yogurt instead of vanilla. I just added a little extra honey for sweetness. Will be making this again.

JUST made this! First time using an avocado in a smoothie and it was delicious! I halved the recipe to make one serving for myself and used a 1/4 tsp of vanilla extract since I only had plain greek yogurt and only used 2 ice cubes. Wonderful flavor, nice and smooth, will definitely make again.
I used almond milk and added half of a banana. I tried the original and it was awesome, so I decided to play with it. it's a great recipe.

It is suprisingly delicious! I am not a big avacado eater but I want to incorporate more into my diet b/c of the benefits it provides. It's sweet enough. Actually sweeter than I thought it would be. I did use coconut milk b/c I don't drink cow milk and I added a dash of cinnamon to mine also. 2 thumbs up :)
This smoothie is so good! I used plain yogurt instead of vanilla and vanilla almond milk instead of regular milk. DELICIOUS!!!

Surprised at how good it was. Seems like might be a great base to play around with to make it a 5 star. I had large avocados and adjusted up from there. I only had a fresh batch of unflavored greek yogurt so I adjusted by adding back some whey and vanilla and increased the honey. Next batch I added a little Triple-Sec - not bad but not the way to go. I'm hoping to come up with a 5 star 'cuz this was worth it.
I really like it. Just i add half banna

Delicious! Made as directed and was perfect! 

People please stop rating recipes and then say you can't give it a five bc you didn't follow instructions or talk about how you changed 10 things. That's like watching part of a movie and trying to critique it. Makes no sense.

YUM! 

I didn't follow exactly but I have been searching for a smoothie recipe that even comes close to the Strawberry/Banana Smoothie that I get from Surf City Squeeze and I finally found it with this!! YUM!! As if I wasn't in love with avocado's and their nutritional goodness before! I love avocado but was wondering how it'd taste in a smoothie - super yum. 

I'm eating mine with a spoon. I will have to either add more milk/almond milk/coconut milk to make it thinner or invest in a cup that has a wide smoothie straw.

Tweaks I made: 
* I didn't use honey (will try it in my next one tomorrow) but added 2 tsp of actual sugar, today.
* Added 1/2 Banana
* Added a handful of Strawberries
* Added a handful of Raspberries
* Added 1 1/2 Tbs Coconut, Flax seed and Chia Protein Mix.

Will be making this again and again! Thank you for the recipe!!

This is wonderful. I use agave instead of honey. But everyone in the house loves this (even the picky eaters). You can substitute the milk for almond or coconut milk, as well. Add some protein powder and you are good to go!
Tasted so good!! Added tapioca (boba) and it was just like the smoothies I get at a chinese restaurant down the street!
First avocado smothie I ever prepare... and simply great!!! High five!
Perfect creamy texture with just the right amount of sweet!

I'm obsessed with how thick creamy and rich this recipe is!!! I give it 4 stars because I'm not big on avacado and the flavor isn't amazing to me but replace the milk with dark chocolate almond milk and it's worth 5 stars sooooooo gooooood
Very creamy and tasty. Next time though I will add a little less honey and more milk! Hubby found it too sweet.
Excellent. I added some extra honey and a few teaspoons of granulated sugar to make it a little sweeter
I follow this recipe exactly and love it! My toddler enjoys it too which is a bonus. I make this at least once a week when I crave it! I use strawberry Greek yogurt.
Delicious Avocado Smothie! Since I ran out of honey, I added 1 tablespoon of brown sugar and it tasted great, will definitely do this again.
I did not have yoghurt on hand so used frozen vanilla ice cream instead (therefore no ice cubes needed). Utterly delicious!!! Can't give it a five as I made a change.

We were in a pinch and didn't have the yogurt, so I added about 1/2 c more milk, and a few drops of vanilla. Was out of honey, and substituted maple syrup. Yummy. We thought we were drinking a milkshake. Will definitely make again. Need to go buy more honey. This is a great alternative for taking care of an "ice cream fixation". Way healthier.

Add extra honey or a teaspoon of brown sugar if you're not crazy for a pervading guacamole taste.

It's also very good with almond milk and greek yogurt subbed for normal milk and normal yogurt, respectively.

Made with 3 avocados, about 1/2 c vanilla yogurt, 1/2 c milk a scoop of ice. Needed a bit of water to make thinner. Really delicious. Would also be good as a dessert-like mousse. 
Also made with avocado and 2 bananas, about 1/2 cup milk, 1/2 cup yogurt and ice. Fantastic. The kids loved it!
I added a banana, used low fat natural yogurt & eliminated the milk. It was delicious!
Smooth and delicious!
so yummy. I used low fat yogurt and half a cup of 1 % milk instead of a whole cup . but other than that I would definitely make again.

Easy and yummy! I made just a few changes to fit with our paleo diet.
I made mine a single serving: 1/2 an avacado, 1/2 cup almond milk and 1 frozen banana.
I used everything listed plus chocholate protein powder and my husband and I really enjoyed it!!
I used 2 tbsp tupelo honey instead of 3 tbsp. Turned out delicious and creamy!
I loved it! It was so cool, rich, and creamy! The yogurt was a bit too much, but I didn't use vanilla: I used plain. :p
Good
A very good recipe! Enjoyed it very much! I added peach flavored yoghurt instead and its still good & extra refreshing! :)
Awesome smoothie! Great balance of cream and sweetness

I was given a lot of avocados, so in searching for new avocado recipes I tried this one. I had big avocados (local from Yucatan) so I used half first just in case that was enough and followed the rest exactly. This is wonderful! Delicious and refreshing. Thank you loveinit!!
It was pretty decent. Very smooth and pretty sweet when using the 1/2 cup of vanilla yogurt and honey. Very easy as well.
I skipped the honey, and added a peeled orange for sweetness instead. Came out great.
Wow! This smoothie is amazing! I made it as is, but added my vanilla protein powder to it. I didn't want it to end! Awesome breakfast!!
A little bit too thick to my taste, so I added 50% more milk.
I add about a cup of kale to mine. Delicious!!!

I am dairy intolerant so I took the advise of many on here and made this with half a banana instead on yogurt, and coconut milk instead of dairy milk. I also used stevia instead of honey and added vanilla. It was a little bland (which I acknowledge is probably my own fault for skipping the honey), but for those in the same boat, I then added several mint leaves and WOW! It is so smooth and creamy, and the mint made it feel like a milkshake. So even though I changed the recipe quite a bit, it gets 5 stars for being the perfect foil to personalize for your own needs and preferences.
Very good for people that don't want the yogurt use 1 frozen banana instead! Perfect!
Love!
love love love.. this is really rich and high in carbs, so not an everyday thing.
I was skeptical about using such a pasty bland vegetable......this is delicious next time I have i will add a bit of cocoa
Awesome recipe!! Just got into making smoothies and this, by far, is my favorite. Its filling enough to replace a meal, but still tasty enough to satisfy a late-night sweets craving.
Amazing taste! I used 1tbsp honey and coconut almond milk. So delicious
I loved this! I used plain greek yogurt instead of vanilla and all organic ingredients and it was perfect.
I thought this would taste bad but it's incredible! Add a bit of coconut extract and a but more all natural honey and it's like desert. Fills you up and gives you lots of energy
Smooth and delicious!
Good!

I didn't know what to expect...so I told myself I make it exactly how the recipe is and then tweak it...(didn't have regular milk,used soy milk instead) when I tasted it I was like WOW!:) didn't add nothing else and I was pleasantly surprised that it tasted so yummy! *My bf don't like avocados so much,but he loved the smoothie!
This is surprisingly good! Even my kids (ages 2 and 4) really liked it. I did try the smoothie with and without a banana. For my taste, I liked it much better with the banana. Very good.

This smoothie is soo good! I didn't have any vanilla yogurt at home so added plain yogurt with half teaspoon of vanilla extract instead. The smoothie came out a little thick so I added a little more milk to even out the consistency. Super fast and easy to make!

OMG Avocado smoothie! If you like the taste of avocados on their own, you will love this smoothies. But I gave it four stars because you have to use half the yogurt and 3/4 the milk. Add the honey to taste. Some like it sweeter than others.

Its very good. I love avocados so i was giddy because avocado is my life. Me and my family loved it. It was a little rich though, so i couldnt finish it. Im going to put a little less avocado and more milk and ice next time .
this. was. fantastic.

Delicious!! I didn't have any yogurt, so I used about a tablespoon of sour cream (scary to me too) and 4 ice cubes. Honey was definitely needed! Didn't make it too sweet, but perfectly sweet. I also used vanilla almond milk, cause that is all I drink :) overall simple and great smoothie.
Love this recipe! It has, long-since become a family favorite!
I didn't add honey, but added half a banana and light regular vanilla yogurt with non fat milk. Really good! Very smooth and filling.
Nice taste but my avocado wasn't ripe enough. Will try again later.
I was looking for a new way to get more avocados into my diet. This is perfect! It's delicious...my new favorite smoothie.
I was looking for a new way to get more avocados into my diet. This is perfect! It's delicious...my new favorite smoothie.
